questions.explanation:
7. Will the bank be open over the holiday weekend?
(A) Yes, as far as I know. → Correct (directly answers whether the bank will be open)
(B) Yesterday evening. → Incorrect (refers to time, not bank hours)
(C) I didn't realize that. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

8. Why did we hire so many people?
(A) A high-rise building. → Incorrect (unrelated to hiring reason)
(B) I don't have much more. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Because we have several new major contracts. → Correct (explains the reason for hiring)

9. You have the presentation slides ready to go, right?
(A) It's a fantastic gift. → Incorrect (unrelated to presentation slides)
(B) No, I'm still working on them. → Correct (addresses the status of the slides)
(C) I went there yesterday. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

10. How long is the flight to London?
(A) Just those three. → Incorrect (unrelated to flight duration)
(B) More often than not. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Less than four hours. → Correct (specifies the flight duration)

11. Who won the employee-of-the-month award in January?
(A) That project was completed last month. → Incorrect (unrelated to the award winner)
(B) You are a highly valued employee. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Someone from Human Resources. → Correct (identifies the winner)

12. Did we get enough volunteers for the music festival?
(A) Did you volunteer last year? → Incorrect (asks a question, doesn’t confirm volunteers)
(B) At the hotel on Central Boulevard. → Incorrect (refers to location, not volunteers)
(C) Yes, some of my friends even agreed to participate. → Correct (confirms sufficient volunteers)

13. Will the product be sold locally or nationwide?
(A) By October twenty-seventh. → Incorrect (refers to time, not sales scope)
(B) Locally, to begin with. → Correct (specifies the sales scope)
(C) No, I'm staying home. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

14. Would you please put the new ink cartridge into the printer?
(A) Sure, that should be easy. → Correct (agrees to the request)
(B) It's in today's paper. → Incorrect (unrelated to the printer task)
(C) I don't have a shopping cart. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'cartridge' and is irrelevant)

15. I'll need to replace the belt on the tractor.
(A) Will they be there tomorrow, too? → Incorrect (unrelated to belt replacement)
(B) Yes, that's what the technician recommended. → Correct (confirms the need for replacement)
(C) Everyone agreed to that meeting time. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

16. How did the project discussion go this morning?
(A) Fine, but we still need to finalize some details. → Correct (describes the discussion outcome)
(B) So we met in the library. → Incorrect (refers to location, not outcome)
(C) Sure, I could spend five minutes on the assignment. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

17. Which of these contracts should be renewed this month?
(A) All client information is in this folder. → Correct (this answer)
(B) On the fifth floor. → Incorrect (refers to location, not contracts)
(C) My library book is overdue. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

18. Did the workers mop the floors again today?
(A) Yes, they used special cloths. → Correct (confirms the floors were mopped)
(B) Sure, if you think they'll fit. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) The notice on the door. → Incorrect (unrelated to mopping)

19. Make sure you sign up for the seminar next week.
(A) A famous presenter. → Incorrect (unrelated to signing up)
(B) I attended last week's session. → Correct (refers to past event, this answer)
(C) I'll need you to sign for the package. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'sign up')

20. Why don't we pick up some lunch from the cafeteria?
(A) I already ate. → Correct (explains why the suggestion is declined)
(B) On the corner of First and Maple Streets. → Incorrect (refers to location, not lunch)
(C) The new manager. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

21. Please put in a request for Mona to get access to the database.
(A) Yes, I like that type of computer. → Incorrect (unrelated to database access)
(B) The IT specialist is out of the office this week. → Correct (explains potential delay in the request)
(C) The conference room upstairs. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

22. Call me when your flight arrives so I can come get you.
(A) He's at gate seventeen. → Incorrect (refers to location, not pickup plan)
(B) A direct flight from Tokyo. → Incorrect (unrelated to pickup arrangement)
(C) Kavi's picking me up. → Correct (indicates an alternative pickup plan)

23. Where will the workshop take place?
(A) It's still in the planning stages. → Correct (refers to planning, this answer)
(B) All day Friday. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)
(C) No, I don't usually shop there. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

24. Would you like to be seated indoors or on the patio?
(A) It's very hot today. → Correct (implies a preference for indoors due to weather)
(B) I read that book. → Incorrect (unrelated to seating preference)
(C) I'm looking for pumpkin seeds. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

25. When would you like to see the doctor for your next checkup?
(A) She checks her e-mail daily. → Incorrect (unrelated to scheduling)
(B) I'll be out of town until April. → Correct (addresses availability for the checkup)
(C) It's next to the waiting room. → Incorrect (refers to location, not time)

26. Does Ms. Shimizu usually come to the office on Mondays or Tuesdays?
(A) By public transportation. → Incorrect (refers to travel method, not days)
(B) Meeting room seven. → Incorrect (refers to location, not days)
(C) Ask her assistant. → Correct (directs to a source for the answer)

27. Where can I move the file cabinet?
(A) Hector's office is empty. → Correct (suggests a location for the cabinet)
(B) I think that file cabinet's over there. → Incorrect (vague and not specific)
(C) Some folders and papers. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

28. When will Dr. Gao give her speech?
(A) The conference schedule hasn't been finalized. → Correct (addresses the timing of the speech)
(B) I like the view from your office. → Incorrect (unrelated to the speech)
(C) Attached in her e-mail. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

29. The catering service is calling to ask about the fund-raising dinner.
(A) There should be some in the refrigerator. → Incorrect (unrelated to the catering inquiry)
(B) Yes, over 12,000 dollars. → Incorrect (refers to funds, not the dinner plans)
(C) I wasn't involved in the planning. → Correct (explains inability to answer the inquiry)

30. Our team will be taking a lunch break soon.
(A) OK, I'll see if there's an empty conference room. → Correct (assumes lunch is in a conference room, this answer)
(B) Remember to return it. → Incorrect (unrelated to lunch break)
(C) No, we took the stairs. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

31. Which door should I go through to leave the warehouse?
(A) He left early yesterday. → Incorrect (unrelated to exit location)
(B) The key card you were issued works for any exit. → Correct (provides guidance on exiting)
(C) An unusually large order. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
